title: Smartphone motion tutorial
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to measure the movement of your smartphone on one axis.

Select **SmartphoneMotion** to make your smartphone vibrate

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/SmatphoneMotion-Item.png)

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Move the **axis**

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/smartphonemotion/image.png)

and the **event**

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/smartphonemotion/event.png)

components into the workspace

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Log/Log.png) on the sidebar,

move the **print** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Log/print.png)
and put the print and axis components as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/smartphonemotion/log.png)
this is to show by console the movement measurement of your smartphone on the x-axis.

Put the components and select and axis as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/smartphonemotion/blocks.png)

this is to show by console the measurement of the movement of the smartphone on the x-axis when the smartphone moves on the x-axis, or y-axis, or z-axis.
